title: How to Use Google Dorks In Your Searches: Complete Guide

steps.title: Dorks are special operators added to your Google search.
steps.content: Dorks are special operators added to your Google search. These commands help you find things more efficiently. It may also help you find things that wouldn't show up on the search results page at all. Dorking is considered an advanced search technique, but it's easy to learn! Keep reading to learn how to do it.

steps.title: Simply add one or more dorks to your search query.
steps.content: Simply add one or more dorks to your search query. Your query and each dork should be separated by a space. For example, if you wanted to search for something on Facebook, you can filter out search results from all other sites by writing [query here] site:facebook.com .

steps.title: You can search (most) commands without a query.
steps.content: You can search (most) commands without a query. This is especially useful for commands like define: . Some commands, however, like filetype: must be searched with a query. For example, if you wanted to define the word "sanctimonious," you would search define:sanctimonious .
